Title: Credential compromise via phishing leading to AD compromise
Description: Phishing or credential reuse leads to compromise of privileged accounts and lateral movement.
ExistingControls: Limited MFA for some admins;  Splunk detection
MitigationActions: Roll out MFA for privileged accounts; phishing awareness campaign; tune MFA/credential detection; remove persistent local admin
Notes: Start with admin OU and VPN; include service accounts after pilot

Title: Ransomware encrypts file shares
Description: Malicious binary executes and encrypts files on A-004 and connected shares.
MitigationActions: Harden file server, implement FIM, immutable backups, network isolate infected host, quarterly restore drills
Notes: Prioritize FIM and immutable backup configs

Title: Exfiltration of sensitive data via compromised host
Description: Attacker exfiltrates DB or file server data to external host.
ExistingControls: Network ACLs, backups; SIEM rules in design
MitigationActions: Implement egress controls, DLP or network flow detection, tune large-transfer alerts
Notes: Map high-value datasets for DLP scope

Title: Unpatched known CVE exploited to achieve RCE
Description: Unpatched app or OS leads to remote code execution and foothold.
ExistingControls: Manual patch cycles; vulnerability scanning ad-hoc
MitigationActions: Formalize patch pipeline and staging tests; prioritize patches by asset criticality
Notes: Add authenticated scans and automated ticketing

Title: Logging gaps create visibility blind spots
Description: Missing telemetry prevents detection of credential abuse and lateral movement.
MitigationActions: Complete onboarding for AD, firewall; validate parse coverage; run weekly ingestion report
Notes: Create telemetry coverage matrix and fill gaps

Title: Unauthorized change to critical device config
Description: Unauthorized or accidental change to firewall/switch or DC config causes outage or security exposure.
MitigationActions: Enforce ticketed changes, CAB approval, config backups and diff monitoring
Notes: Start with firewall and DC config backups

Title: Loss of backup integrity or backup server compromise
Description: Compromised backup server threatens recoverability and confidentiality.
ExistingControls: Backups produced but offsite rotation needs formalization
MitigationActions: Encrypt backups, rotate to offsite, validate checksums, restrict backup access
